alert.note: Alert for Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 7:33PM MDT until June 25 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Colorado... South Platte River near Kersey affecting Weld County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...South Platte River near Kersey. * WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Considerable lowland and meadow flooding occurs. This level represents a flood that has a 10-percent chance of being equaled or exceeded in any given year. For more information click here. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.1 feet early Saturday morning. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
